publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3531u Murdo Fraser: David Livingstone: Explorer, Missionary, Anti-Slave Campaigner and Doctor—That the Parliament notes that 17 November 2005 marks the 150th anniversary of David Livingstone being the first European to discover the Victoria Falls; believes that the anniversary should be used to mark the important work which David Livingstone undertook as an explorer, missionary, anti-slave campaigner and doctor, having created strong ties with African nations and being celebrated in Zambia as a national hero for bringing Christianity to the country; notes that David Livingstone’s strong campaigning against slavery and for African rights is still an inspiration to people today; believes that his work should inspire a new generation of Scots, and believes that the Scottish Executive should use this occasion to celebrate the work and life of David Livingstone.

S2M-3531*#* Murdo Fraser: David Livingstone: Explorer, Missionary, Anti-Slave Campaigner and Doctor—That the Parliament notes that 17 November 2005 marks the 150th anniversary of David Livingstone being the first European to discover the Victoria Falls; believes that the anniversary should be used to mark the important work which David Livingstone undertook as an explorer, missionary, anti-slave campaigner and doctor, having created strong ties with African nations and being celebrated in Zambia as a national hero for bringing Christianity to the country; notes that David Livingstone’s strong campaigning against slavery and for African rights is still an inspiration to people today; believes that his work should inspire a new generation of Scots, and believes that the Scottish Executive should use this occasion to celebrate the work and life of David Livingstone. Supported by: Fergus Ewing*, Phil Gallie*, Margaret Mitchell*, Mr David Davidson*, Christine Grahame*, Pauline McNeill*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, John Scott*, Nora Radcliffe*, Derek Brownlee*, Fiona Hyslop*, Mary Scanlon*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Shiona Baird*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Brian Adam*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mike Pringle*, Bill Aitken*, Mr Bruce McFee*
S2M-3531# David Livingstone: Explorer, Missionary, Anti-Slave Campaigner and Doctor (lodged on 7 November 2005) Murray Tosh*
S2M-3531# David Livingstone: Explorer, Missionary, Anti-Slave Campaigner and Doctor (lodged on 7 November 2005) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-3531# Murdo Fraser: David Livingstone: Explorer, Missionary, Anti-Slave Campaigner and Doctor—That the Parliament notes that 17 November 2005 marks the 150th anniversary of David Livingstone being the first European to discover the Victoria Falls; believes that the anniversary should be used to mark the important work which David Livingstone undertook as an explorer, missionary, anti-slave campaigner and doctor, having created strong ties with African nations and being celebrated in Zambia as a national hero for bringing Christianity to the country; notes that David Livingstone’s strong campaigning against slavery and for African rights is still an inspiration to people today; believes that his work should inspire a new generation of Scots, and believes that the Scottish Executive should use this occasion to celebrate the work and life of David Livingstone. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Phil Gallie, Margaret Mitchell, Mr David Davidson, Christine Grahame, Pauline McNeill, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Mr Alasdair Morrison, John Scott, Nora Radcliffe, Derek Brownlee, Fiona Hyslop, Mary Scanlon, Mr Jamie Stone, Shiona Baird, Mrs Nanette Milne, Brian Adam, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mike Pringle, Bill Aitken, Mr Bruce McFee, Murray Tosh, Donald Gorrie, Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-3531# David Livingstone: Explorer, Missionary, Anti-Slave Campaigner and Doctor (lodged on 7 November 2005) Mrs Margaret Ewing*
S2M-3531# David Livingstone: Explorer, Missionary, Anti-Slave Campaigner and Doctor (lodged on 7 November 2005) Michael McMahon*
S2M-3531# David Livingstone: Explorer, Missionary, Anti-Slave Campaigner and Doctor (lodged on 7 November 2005) Elaine Smith*
S2M-3531# David Livingstone: Explorer, Missionary, Anti-Slave Campaigner and Doctor (lodged on 7 November 2005) Susan Deacon*
